authorAttributions.displayName: Jeffrey Fisher, M.D. - Cardiology Consultants of New York, P.C.
Jeffrey Fisher, M.D. - Cardiology Consultants of New York, P.C.

adrFormatAddress: 311 E 72nd St, New York, NY 10021-4684, USA

originalText.text:
I don't even know where to begin. Let me start by saying that I am a lucky man because I am under Dr. Fisher's care. I wouldn't survive if it weren't for him. I went to Dr. Fisher with heartburn. He did an echocardiogram and then started the stress test. Halfway through, he stopped the test, kept all monitoring devices on, and called an ambulance. Dr. Fisher knew I already had a heart attack and needed to go to the hospital right away. He called the hospital to tell them that I was on my way. He explained the situation's urgency and asked the hospital doctors to do the angioplasty. Throughout this process, he kept in touch with the doctors in the hospital and called me the next day when I was in my hospital bed.
I found Dr. Fisher to be very professional and attentive. He does an excellent job managing his schedule as well. I have never had to wait during an office visit. His Office staff are very accommodating. I don't think I can find another cardiologist who is as knowledgeable and caring as Dr. Fisher. I am his patient for life.

originalText.text: It is a great opportunity to be able to have access to the best cardiologist. Dr  Jeffrey Fisher has been my Primary care Doctor for the Last 20 years, I will recommend him to any one who needs excellent medical care especially in the field of Cardiology. He is very reliable in making Referrals to other care givers who provides the best care you can receive. On behalf of my family I would like to thank Dr. Fisher for being there  for us, it is a blessing to have access to his services.

originalText.text: Dr Fisher is a great doctor.  His appointments run on time unless he has an emergency.  He is open to all questions or concerns.  His assistant is very kind and professional and draws blood perfectly.  His office manager is very professional and very helpful . Thank you Dr Fisher

originalText.text:
Update: In September of 2023 I brought my mother to Dr. Fisher. She was suffering from such shortness of breath she could not walk more than a few steps without needing to stop. Dr. Fisher gave her a 2 hour exam and diagnosed serious heart failure. He was also concerned about an area in her torso that did not seem right and sent her for a CT Scan. Several days later she was diagnosed with Lymphoma. Dr. Fisher delivered the diagnoses with compassion and patiently explained the conditions, answered all questions and assured her that these were treatable conditions.
Dr. Fisher had her admitted into Weill Cornell Hospital's cardiac unit and treated her heart failure. When she left the hospital she had no shortness of breath a bounce in her step. Dr. Fisher is now coordinating her Lymphoma treatment and we are hoping for similar results.
It is not an exaggeration to say that Dr. Fisher saved my mother's life. I have never met a more knowledgeable, patient and detail oriented doctor. I can not recommend him enough and every friend I have recommended him to has been equally satisfied.

Visiting Dr. Fisher is always a pleasure. In addition to providing exceptional healthcare he is generous with his time and enthusiastic about sharing his knowledge and expertise. His exceptional diagnostic skills and network of specialists are second to none.

originalText.text:
If you were asked to identify the qualities that the "ideal" doctor would possess and you were to reply:  exceptional depth of medical knowledge, precise diagnostician, empathy,  and true concern for the welfare of patients, would you be able to find a doctor who meets this "ideal?"  You would if you chose Dr. Fisher.
I have been his patient since 2015 and his "ideal" qualities have enabled me to receive the pathway to the proper medical treatment that I needed to address my heart problem - while other cardiologists had tried, Dr. Fisher succeeded!
